text: John Stead (21 April 1854 26 August 1922) was a Scottish-born New Zealand politician. He was a losing candidate in the 1894 Invercargill mayoral election and 1896 Invercargill mayoral election. He was deputy mayor of Invercargill from 1915 to 1916 and mayor of Invercargill twice (1898–1899 and 1917–1921). He was the father of All Blacks rugby player Billy Stead. == Sources == * * ==See also== *1898 Invercargill mayoral election *1917 Invercargill mayoral election ==External links== *John Stead genealogy Category:1854 births Category:1922 deaths Category:Scottish emigrants to New Zealand Category:People from Girvan Category:People from South Ayrshire Category:Invercargill City Councillors Category:Deputy mayors of Invercargill Category:Mayors of Invercargill Category:Burials at Eastern Cemetery, Invercargill
title: John Stead (mayor)
